subject: Re: [junit] Help plz...
msgSnippet: Hi, I Changed my Test suite() method to  : public static Test suite(){ TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(); suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class); return
messageBody:
Hi,
I Changed my Test suite() method to :

public static Test suite(){
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
return suite;

Its giving the following compile time error :

TestLanguageVector.java:25: addTest(junit.framework.Test) in
junit.framework.TestSuite cannot be applied to (java.lang.Class)
suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);

What does this say, how should i proceed ...

Regds
chan



On Tuesday 16 September 2003 8:33 pm, Jason Rogers wrote:
> Your suite() method is wrong. It should say:
>
> public static Test suite(){
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
> return suite;
> }
>
> What exception is thrown when you give another index (other than 2)?
>
> =jason
>
> On Tue, 2003-09-16 at 06:22, Chan wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > Just go thro this program, it does not run for negative test
> > and how must the runtime bug must be fixed.
> >
> > Plz suggest me a solution.
> >
> > regards
> > chandu
> >

> > */

> > System.out.println("The size args.length ="+length);
> > for (int i=0; i<length ; i++)
> > {
> > list.addElement(args[i]);
> > }
> > list.insertElementAt("COBOL",2);
> > int size= list.size();
> > System.out.println("The size list.size() ="+size);
> > String listArray[]=new String[size];
> > list.copyInto(listArray);
> > System.out.println("List of Languages");
> > for (int i=0; i<size ; i++)
> > {
> > System.out.println(listArray[i]);
> > }
> >
> > }
> > }
> >
> >
> >
> > /* Test Program TestLanguageVector.java*/

> > comments i have typed */
> >
> >
> > import junit.framework.*;
> > import java.util.*;
> > import java.io.*;
> > class TestLanguageVector extends TestCase {
> > LanguageVector langvect =new LanguageVector();
> > public void testlangvect(){
> > System.out.println("value of langvect.length"+langvect.length);
> > assertEquals(2,langvect.length);
> > /* the assert fails when i give other value than 2, and the program
> > throws exception and stops, the next assertion is not tested and no
> > FALIURE mssg is given.*/
> > assertEquals("COBOL",langvect.list.elementAt(2));
> > }
> >

> > return new TestSuite("TestLanguageVector.class");

> > LanguageVector.main(params);
> > /*1.If the below two stmts are not added the testlangvect() is not
> > getting innitaited */
